Class PositionProperties

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

The container to store all properties of Position Unlike Position and IPositionProperties this class is not immutable and allows to change its properties after creation Usually, this class is used to prepare all parameters and then pass it to position constructor Position(IPositionProperties)

[PublicAPI]
public class PositionProperties : IPositionProperties, IPositionValues, IInstrumentProvider, ITimeZoneProvider, IBrokerageProviderProvider

Properties

AlgoKey

Contains a key that can be used by a strategy to distinguish its positions from other positions Usually, the first order that creates a position sets this key

public string? AlgoKey { get; set; }

Property Value

string

AveragePrice

Average price of position. For hedging position it means open price. for netting positions - the average price of all openings

public double AveragePrice { get; set; }

Property Value

double

BrokerageProvider

Reference to IBrokerageProvider

public IBrokerageProvider BrokerageProvider { get; }

Property Value

IBrokerageProvider

CreateTime

Time of the creation of position Since not all brokers support this info, the parameter can be uninitialized (equal to MinValue) See also BrokerageCapability.PositionCreateTime

public DateTime CreateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime

Description

Any text information attached to position and stored on client side DB using ITradingEntitiesService

public string? Description { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Instrument

Instrument. This property must always return not-nullable value If the provider may return null then consider using INullableInstrumentProvider

public Instrument Instrument { get; }

Property Value

Instrument

MarketPosition

Returns Long, Short or Flat depending on SignedQuantity If quantity is negative, then the position is short If quantity is positive, then the position is long If quantity is zero, then the position is flat

public MarketPosition MarketPosition { get; }

Property Value

MarketPosition

PositionId

Identification of position. Commonly is used for hedging accounts, where multiple open positions for the same instrument are possible. In this case Id is used to distinguish one position from another For netting accounts usually id = null because it may be identified by natural key: instrument

public string? PositionId { get; set; }

Property Value

string

SignedQuantity

Position quantity. Positive value means Long position, negative value - short position

public SignedQuantity SignedQuantity { get; set; }

Property Value

SignedQuantity

StopLoss

The stop order (also known as stop loss) attached to position

public StopLimitOrder? StopLoss { get; set; }

Property Value

StopLimitOrder

StrategyName

Name of strategy that placed the initial order

public string? StrategyName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

TakeProfit

The limit order (also known as take profit) attached to position

public StopLimitOrder? TakeProfit { get; set; }

Property Value

StopLimitOrder

TimeZone

Returns a time zone which a provider uses for as a primary time zone

public TimeZoneInfo TimeZone { get; }

Property Value

TimeZoneInfo

Remarks

For the specified instrument it is better to use TradingHours and TimeZone

UpdateTime

Time of the last update of position Since not all brokers support this info, the parameter can be uninitialized (equal to MinValue) See also BrokerageCapability.PositionUpdateTime

public DateTime UpdateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime
